title: Safe Crossing of Thin Ice
brief: How to safely cross thin ice by distributing your weight to prevent breaking through.
steps: Step 1: Test ice thickness ahead of you with a pole or stick before putting full weight on it.
Step 2: Lie flat on your stomach to distribute your weight across the largest possible area.
Step 3: Crawl forward slowly, keeping your body spread out and movements deliberate.
Step 4: If ice begins to crack, immediately spread arms and legs wider and move backwards to thicker ice.
warnings: Never walk upright on thin ice - concentrated weight will cause breakthrough.
Falling through ice in arctic conditions can be fatal within minutes due to cold shock and hypothermia.
